title: Energy conservation- asteroid moving toward planet

content.question: An asteroid is moving directly toward a planet, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. At a later time, as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the asteroid is closer to the planet and still moving directly toward it. The change to the planet’s velocity is negligible. Which of the following correctly describe the change in the total mechanical energy of the asteroid-planet system, <math alttext="delta E sub total" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>tot</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, and the change in the kinetic energy of the asteroid, <math alttext="delta K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>K</mi></math>, between Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta E sub total equals 0; delta K equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>tot</mtext></msub></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>=</mo></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0</mn></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>;</mo></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace></mstyle><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>K</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="delta E sub total equals 0; delta K is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>tot</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>;</mo><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>K</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>
